response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "medium", "Being a young adult (21) suggests a higher propensity for risk-taking behaviors, although it is not the strongest factor."],
    ["Race", "low", "Identifying as White has minimal impact on recidivism risk compared to other factors."],
    ["Criminal History", "high", "Four arrests and a record of convictions strongly indicate a higher likelihood of reoffending."],
    ["Employment", "high", "Lack of employment over the past year is a significant risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Substance Use", "medium", "Recent marijuana use contributes to risk, though it is generally considered less severe than other drug abuses."],
    ["Mental Health", "medium", "Experiencing depressive symptoms suggests underlying issues that could impact behavior, contributing to risk at a moderate level."],
    ["Social Support", "medium", "Living alone and never having been married may indicate reduced social support, elevating recidivism risk moderately."],
    ["Education", "low", "Having a high school diploma and ongoing college education provides a protective factor that mitigates risk somewhat."],
    ["Family Background", "medium", "Growing up in a larger household (size 6) can imply both support and potential instability, marking it as a moderate factor."],
    ["Religious Influence", "medium", "A lack of belief in divine control may correlate with reduced external social constraints, contributing to moderate risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Being a young adult (21) suggests a higher propensity for risk-taking behaviors, although it is not the strongest factor.
Identifying as White has minimal impact on recidivism risk compared to other factors.
Four arrests and a record of convictions strongly indicate a higher likelihood of reoffending.
Lack of employment over the past year is a significant risk factor for recidivism.
Recent marijuana use contributes to risk, though it is generally considered less severe than other drug abuses.
Experiencing depressive symptoms suggests underlying issues that could impact behavior, contributing to risk at a moderate level.
Living alone and never having been married may indicate reduced social support, elevating recidivism risk moderately.
Having a high school diploma and ongoing college education provides a protective factor that mitigates risk somewhat.
Growing up in a larger household (size 6) can imply both support and potential instability, marking it as a moderate factor.
A lack of belief in divine control may correlate with reduced external social constraints, contributing to moderate risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 4 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 10 inches and weighs 215 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 2-year college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived in a household of size 6. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
